title: Face Adversity (+Stat)
description: When you overcome opposition or danger using stealth, piloting, accuracy, discipline (Roll+Mettle); knowledge, mechanics, first-aid (Roll+Expertise); athletics, endurance, strength, health (Roll+Physique); charm, diplomacy, bargaining, lies (Roll+Influence); or open computer systems and networks (Roll+Interface).

outcomes.text: You overcome the opposition or danger, just as you described.
The danger is overcome, but at a price; the GM will offer you a cost or a hard choice.

title: Assessment (+Stat)
description: When you collect critical information about an important, dangerous or mysterious subject using stealth, focus, cunning (Roll+Mettle); research and experimentation (Roll+Expertise); exploration, labor, strenuous activity (Roll+Physique); informants, interviews, gossip (Roll+Influence); or the SectorNet or open networks (Roll+Interface).

outcomes.text: You gain significant information about the subject, and earn a Data Point about it as well.
The GM will reveal interesting, potentially useful information about the subject. Or they might ask you to do so.
The GM will reveal facts about the subject you probably wish were not true.

title: Get Involved (+Stat)
description: When an ally makes a Move and you affect the result using stealth, piloting, accuracy, or bravery (Roll+Mettle); education, mechanics or first aid (Roll+Expertise); athletics, endurance, strength or health (Roll+Physique); charm, diplomacy, bargaining or lies (Roll+Influence); or open computer systems and networks (Roll+Interface).

outcomes.text: Choose 1:
bullets: Improve a failure(6-) into a partial success (7-9).
Improve a partial success(7-9) into a full success (10+).
Downgrade a full success(10+) into a partial success(7-9).
Downgrade a partial success(7-9) into a failure(6-).

outcomes.text: As above, but you incur a cost, complication or hard choice in order to get involved.

title: Open Fire (+Mettle)
description: When you engage enemy forces in long ranged, cover-to-cover firefights, describe your tactics, primary targets and Roll+Mettle.

outcomes.text: You win this engagement. Your targets are dead, injured, incapacitated, retreating, pinned, surrendering, etc.
As above, but the GM will choose 1 or more of the following consequences:
bullets: You suffer harm during the exchange.
The exchange causes undesirable collateral damage.
The battle shifts, changing threats or adding new ones.
The targets actually suffer a lesser fate (GM chooses).

title: Launch Assault (+Physique)
description: When you engage enemy forces in chaotic close-quarters combat, describe your tactics and primary targets, then Roll+Physique.

outcomes.text: You win this engagement. Your targets are dead, injured, incapacitated, retreating, pinned, surrendering, etc.
As above, but the GM will choose 1 or more of the following consequences:
bullets: You suffer harm during the exchange.
The exchange causes undesirable collateral damage.
The battle shifts, changing threats or adding new ones.
The targets actually suffer a lesser fate (GM chooses).

title: Patch Up (+Expertise)
description: When using appropriate medical supplies/tools to repair harm to people or machinery, Roll+Expertise.

outcomes.text: Choose 1 from the list below.
Choose 1, but you've reached the limit of what you can do; you cannot re-attempt to Patch Up the subject for now.

bullets: Treat a single minor, major or severe injury/damage
Treat a malfunction or minor debility
Stabilize a major debility
Perform a medical/technical procedure

title: Command (+Influence)
description: When you issue a command to a group that is inclined to follow your orders, Roll+Influence.

outcomes.text: They follow those orders to the best of their ability, though there may be costs in time, resources or personnel.
As above, but their disposition or effectiveness has been significantly impacted in some way. This crew will not accept a new Command until those issues have been dealt with.

title: Access (+Interface)
description: When you spend several minutes accessing a locked, protected system or network with the appropriate tools, Roll+Interface.

outcomes.text: Credentials verified, access granted. The system is now open to Interface-based Moves.
As above, but your breach is detected. The owners of the system will likely retaliate soon, either electronically, legally or physically.

title: Brace for Impact (+Armor)
description: When you would suffer harm, the GM will tell you the Severity (Minor, Major, Severe, Critical or Fatal). Roll+Armor.

outcomes.text: The severity is reduced by two levels.
The severity is reduced by one level.
You suffer an injury of that severity.
You also suffer debilities, incur costs/troubles, or suffer an injury of a greater severity, at the GM's discretion.

title: Shields Up
description: When one of the starship sections would suffer damage from outside, the pilot Rolls 2d6. If a character is at the shield station, they Roll instead, and add their +Interface.

outcomes.text: The severity of the damage is reduced by two.
The severity of the damage is reduced by one.
Shields down! The section suffers damage, and the shields need to be repaired or recharged before they can be used again.

title: Wild Jump
description: When you force your ship to make a Wild Jump, Roll 2d6.

outcomes.text: The crew only suffers nausea, headaches and other minor effects. You reach a point within a week's travel of your destination, or choose from the list below.
The illness and hallucinations are pronounced. The GM chooses one from the list below:
bullets: You find an uncharted world, ready for exploration.
You find exploitable resources, there for the taking.
You discover a scientifically-interesting phenomenon.
You discover wreckage or ruins of unknown origin.
You find a new path to a well-known destination.
You encounter a faction or culture that is new to you.

outcomes.text: The GM will describe the ugly, debilitating, terrifying consequences. It's full of stars.

bullets: You find an uncharted world, ready for exploration.
You find exploitable resources, there for the taking.
You discover a scientifically-interesting phenomenon.
You discover wreckage or ruins of unknown origin.
You find a new path to a well-known destination.
You encounter a faction or culture that is new to you.

title: Cramped Quarters
description: When you've been trapped in cramped quarters with the same people for a significant amount of time (a leg of an interstellar journey, etc), choose a character trapped here with you and Roll 2d6.

outcomes.text: Describe how the two of you bonded over the past few days.
Reveal/discover the answer to their question about an aspect of yourself or your past.
Describe what caused the newest hurt feelings or bad blood between you.

title: Acquisition (+Cargo)
description: When you demand important services or assets from a market able to supply those demands, Roll+0. If you offer a cargo unit as part of the deal, Roll+ that cargo's Class.

outcomes.text: The deal goes through; you get what you asked for.
The deal goes through if the seller/market is amiably disposed toward the deal. Otherwise, as 7-9.
The deal will only go through if you accept a cost, a task or a lesser asset/service instead of what you asked for.
The deal will only go through if you call in a Favor.

title: Barter (+Cargo)
description: When you exchange a foreign unit of cargo for local trade goods, Roll + the Class of the cargo unit.

outcomes.text: You attract the attention of a faction or individual with a unique item or service to trade.
You get a higher Class cargo of local goods in exchange, to a max of Class 4.
You get a higher Class cargo, to a max of Class 4, and the GM chooses one flaw:
bullets: The negotiations take many days to complete.
The goods need special care (fragile, hazardous, etc).
The goods are very odd, distasteful or bizarre.
The provenance or legality of the goods is dubious.

title: Drastic Upheaval
description: Choose a new advancement from any career

title: Adaptation
description: Choose a type of environment. You can function normally in that environment.

title: Amplifier
description: Increases memory, attention, thought speed, and the range of supernatural abilities.

title: Beauty
description: Designed to be stunning, dazzling, and distracting.

title: Camouflage
description: Blend into your surroundings, especially when not moving.

title: Connector
description: Choose a type of vehicle, system, or organism. You can physically attach yourself to it, allowing a direct neural interaction.

title: Implements
description: Choose a Kit. It is built directly into your body.
pickOne: Art Kit - Tools to create visual artwork. Paints, brushes, writing implements, paper, chisels, files, twine, tarps, music instruments, etc.
Broadcast Kit - Tools to send and receive signals. Collapsible broadcast antenna, signal boosters, wires, vid screens, recording hardware, portable data drives, etc.
Computer Kit - Tools to access, program, diagnose and repair computer systems. Laptops, diagnostic tools, wires, handheld power sources, portable data drives, etc.
Engineering Kit - Tools to repair and dismantle machinery. Hammers, drills, cutters, wrenches, welders, grips, cables, diagnostic tools, cage lamps, miscellaneous spare parts, etc.
Infiltration Kit - Tools to gain access to forbidden places. Mechanical lockpicks, intrusion hardware, chloroform, glass cutters, disguises, ropes, climbing tools, etc.
Medical Kit - Tools to perform medical treatments. Bandages, scalpels, gels, stimms, scissors, pain killers, surgical braces, dermal regen spray, etc.
Research Kit - Tools to study and experiment out in the field. Specimen jars, hammer and chisel, scalpels, chemical analyser, data recorder, etc.
Ritual Kit - Tools to practice religious and mystic ceremonies. Candles, incense, chalk, dusts, oils, texts, totems, charms, etc.
Survey Kit - Tools to observe and monitor. Range finders, tracking devices, motion sensors, deep scanner tripod, holo-map projector, data recorder, deployable transmitter, etc.
VR Kit - Tools to connect to local cyberscapes. Virtual reality headset, vital-sign monitors, glove-based interface, universal jacks, external storage drives, etc.
Wilderness Kit - Tools to traverse hostile landscapes. Ropes, climbing tools, light sources, breather mask, tent, sleeping bag, heat lamp, thermal blanket, water filter, etc.

title: Link
description: Share thoughts and emotions with others who have the same link.

title: Locomotion
description: Choose a new means of locomotion: slithering, leaping, climbing, swimming, gliding, hovering.

title: Perception
description: Choose a type of information. You can receive sensory data about it when you focus. The more specific the type of information, the more detailed the data collected.

title: Projectile
description: Create effects/projectiles like a Class 1 Firearm. Biomod: Regrow/refill ammunition over time. Cybermod: Spent ammo/cells can be replaced.

title: Prehensile
description: Independent extra limb (or pair of limbs) ending in a Class 0 Melee weapon.

title: Reinforced
description: +1 Armor. Difficult to damage/break.

title: Replacement
description: Create a Class 1 Melee Weapon that replaces a limb. Manual tasks using that limb are Clumsy without an appropriate upgrade (Glove, Flexible, Hidden, Living, etc.). Does not count towards Mod support maximum.

title: Storage
description: Hollow section which can store a variety of small objects. Resists scans.
